title: Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah start a ceasefire after nearly 14 months of fighting
summary: After 14 months of fighting, Israel approved a US-brokered ceasefire agreement with Lebanon's Hezbollah group, ending hostilities linked to the Gaza Strip war. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accepted the deal, while displaced Lebanese families celebrated and prepared to return home.

title: ICC issues arrest warrants for Netanyahu, Hamas officials..
summary: The International Criminal Court has issued arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Hamas officials for alleged crimes against humanity committed during the recent war. Netanyahu has condemned the decision as "a black day in the history of nations."

title: Prison Warden Killed in Car Explosion in Russian-Occupied Ukraine
summary: Sergei Yevsyukov, former head of Olenivka Prison in Russian-occupied Ukraine, was killed in a car explosion in Donetsk, sparking suspicions of targeted attacks on pro-Kremlin figures in occupied territories. Russian authorities have opened a criminal investigation, while Ukrainian media reports suggest the blast was equivalent to 100g of TNT.

title: Relatives of Syrian Victims Express Emotions After Assad's Ousting
summary: Following the collapse of Bashar al-Assad's regime, families are searching for missing relatives believed to have been detained and potentially killed in notorious Syrian prisons. Despite official silence on the matter, relatives have expressed hope that their loved ones may still be alive.

title: Ukrainian President Zelensky Announces 43,000 Troop Deaths in Russian Conflict
summary: Ukrainian President Zelensky has disclosed that 43,000 Ukrainian soldiers have been killed and 370,000 injured since the Russian invasion. While Russia disputes these numbers, Western officials estimate that Russia has suffered around 800,000 casualties. Ukraine's ongoing battlefield losses are attributed to Russia's "meat-grinder" tactics, which prioritize territorial gains over troop preservation.

title: South Korea's Passionate Protesters Witness Hopes for Impeachment Diminish
summary: Amidst lively protests and music outside Seoul's National Assembly, demonstrators demanded President Yoon Suk Yeol's impeachment. Despite Yoon's televised apology, the opposition's impeachment attempt failed due to a boycott by the ruling party, leaving protesters disappointed.

title: Relatives of Victims Express Reaction to Assad's Overthrow
summary: Following the fall of Bashar al-Assad's regime in Syria, crowds gathered at the notorious Saydnaya prison seeking information about detained family members. Relatives of those killed or imprisoned during Assad's rule expressed hope that loved ones may still be alive after tens of thousands were tortured or killed in government jails.

title: Ukrainian President Zelensky Reports 43,000 Soldiers Killed in Russian Invasion
summary: According to a recent report, the estimated death toll of Russian soldiers in Ukraine is significantly lower than previous U.S. estimates, with the report indicating around 20,000 fatalities. However, U.S. officials and military analysts have disputed this figure, suggesting a higher toll of approximately 70,000.

title: Amid Turmoil in Syria, Turkish Forces Engage U.S.-Allied Troops
summary: Turkish-backed rebels clashed with Kurdish forces in northern Syria, potentially escalating tensions between the U.S. and Turkey, who are supporting opposing factions in the conflict. Officials from both countries have not yet commented on the situation. The clash highlights the complex and volatile nature of the ongoing conflict in Syria.
